Chapter:
Isoclinism of Crossed Modules
This chapter describes some functions written by Alper Odabaş and Enver Uslu, and reported in . They consist of some additional basic functions for crossed modules, and some functions dealing specifically with isoclinism.
More operations for crossed modules
The PreXModFixedPointSubgroup(X) for \mathcal{X}=(\partial : S \to R) is the subgroup of elements s \in S fixed under the action of R.
The PreXModStabilizer of \mathcal{X} is the subgroup of elements r \in R which act trivially on the whole of S.
The DisplacementSubgroup of \mathcal{X} is the subgroup D_R(S) of S generated by elements (s^r)s^{-1}.
The DerivedSubXMod of \mathcal{X} is the normal subcrossed module [\mathcal{X},\mathcal{X}] = (\partial' : D_R(S) \to [R,R]) where \partial' is the restriction of \partial.
These constructions are described on pages 19 and 66 of Norrie's thesis .

When X1,X2 are subcrossed modules of X0, and X3 := IntersectionXMod(X1,X2), then the source and range of X3 are the intersections of the sources and ranges of X1 and X2.
